text: Fans of holiday cheer and iconic rom - coms everywhere couldn't help but freak out after it was announced that Love Actually was getting a mini - sequel — and based on these first behind - the - scenes snapshots from producer Emma Freud, it's going to be epic. In a series of photos shared to Twitter this weekend, Freud confirmed that Hugh Grant will be reviving his role as the Prime Minister for the project — while also revealing that he and Natalie ( a. k. a., Martine McCutcheon ) are still happily married.
